titleStmt.title: The life of the glorious virgin S. Clare Togeather with the conuersion, and life of S. Agnes her sister. And of another S. Agnes, daughter to the King of Bohemia. Also the rule of S. Clare. And the life of S. Catharine of Bologna. Translated into English.
Chronicle and institution of the order of the seraphicall father S. Francis. Selections
titleStmt.author: Marcos, de Lisboa, Bishop of Porto, 1511-1591.

titleStmt.title: The life of the glorious virgin S. Clare Togeather with the conuersion, and life of S. Agnes her sister. And of another S. Agnes, daughter to the King of Bohemia. Also the rule of S. Clare. And the life of S. Catharine of Bologna. Translated into English.
Chronicle and institution of the order of the seraphicall father S. Francis. Selections
titleStmt.author: Marcos, de Lisboa, Bishop of Porto, 1511-1591.
Bentley, Catharine, attributed name.
Evelinge, Elizabeth, attributed name.

notesStmt.note: In two parts; part 1 largely extracted from STC 11314.2: "The chronicle and institution of the order of the seraphicall father S. Francis", a translation of: Marcos da Silva, Bp. of Oporto. Chronicas da ordem dos frades menores.

Part 2 is a reissue of STC 5350.7: "The rule .. S. Clare. Togeather with the life, of S. Catharine of Bologna", the latter translated from a French version of D. Paleotti's Vita by E. Evelinge? Or C. Bentley?--Cf. STC.
"Of possessed persons deliuered by the merits of S. Agnes: and of certayne other miracles" has caption title.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.

person.persName: Marcos, de Lisboa, Bishop of Porto,
